Reviews.Title: “Correct”
Reviews.Author: Canard78
Reviews.Content: bad : pay attention when you arrive, you can walk past the entry of the building without seeing it. The hotl desk it at the 5th floor of the building. very small elevator. Small breakfast roomn with poor choice of dishes. Quadruple rooms are small. good : the receptionist speaks fluently english and french, the hotel is modern. Single and double rooms are quite big for this kind of level of rooms in ROme. Bathrooms are well equipped and big. Rooms are modern. Wifi in rooms. Flat TV screen but only one french channel (it doesn't matter since you're not in Rome to watch TV). Our shower was not working but it has been repaired very quickly. As everywhere in Rome, some noise coming from the street but double-glazing is efficient. Very good location near Piazza di Spagna, Via del Corso and Borghese Garden.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous”
Reviews.Author: amanda g
Reviews.Content: my family of 4 stayed here in nov 2011, no complaints hotels was great, brilliant location walking distance to all othe fantastic attractions rome has to offer, we had no problem getting in and out, the reception was open 24hours and we were always looked after. the breakfast was ok, the kids moaned because they had to order their eggs, but you cannot have it all. a modern hotel with all the mod cons, make sure you check out the spa bath, relaxing. be careful of the local restuarants, they like to talk you into more food and then you for the privilage, but then again it is rome, we had a fabulous stay - off to new york next, - hope the hotels their can match up to this standard. a very modern hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean central location modern and new”
Reviews.Author: napervilletraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was 15 min walk from most sights.Spanish steps were 2 blocks away and via condotti High end shopping was five minutes away. Most of staff were extremely cordial and helpful. Breakfast very very adequate and filling and free. go early since if you come too late some items will run out.Noise level was sometimes a small problem. The balcony view was beautiful. Bathroom was huge with nice toiletries. Rainfall shower heads were nice. Room was Smaller than expected but very very clean with a nice flat screen and free wifi. A good value for what you get in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Trevi collection”
Reviews.Author: DaveTrael
Reviews.Content: Nice room, well decorated, great location. The hotel is fine, the rooms are okay, but clean and had a nice balcony which with a bit of leaning could see the capitol building. noisy road outside, but the double glazing doors did their job brilliantly. The air conditioning in the room was a bit rubbish and only seemed to pump heat out what ever we did. The bathroom was clean, but the fancy shower was a bit of a waste as the faulty head on it meant that you would flood the bathroom if you used it on full power. Breakfast was good, nothing hot, but the croissants, cold meats and yoghurts you expect of a continental breakfast where present. The receptionists change pretty much every day, but were very good, and even made us some cappucinos when we asked. They looked after our luggage on the last day which left us plenty of time to go up to the nearby park and take in the Villa Borghese, before heading back to grab our flight. Do make sure to get a cab from the cab rank at the top end of the street though, as it is a fixed fare of 40 Euro to the airport rather than 52 euro for a reception organised car.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: MARIO A
Reviews.Content: WhwnI arrived to the hotel, the people at the reception informed me about the needs to make some maintainace works at my room, and for this reason was mandatory to leave it at 7:00 AM. I received paid 2 nights in advance and when I returned to the hotel for the 2nd night, they sent my luggage to other hotel of lower quality and they took some hours to find my luggage. My original room was asigned to a new customer and other guest commented me about a similar experience in the same day with him. The maintainance was just a lie and I did not receive any apologize from them. They are not serious.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best location anybody could ask for!!!!! Lovely cool modern rooms, very cleaned!!”
Reviews.Author: kikola12
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location few steps away from Fontana di trevi and Spanish steps, lovely cool design of rooms, amazing jaccuzzi room, very clean hotel and great service. Loved our stay there with family just returned last night! Recommend it very much . The only negative we found is the empty and strange area before getting up to the reception area which that was lovely and very welcoming as well as the great and friendly staff!! Should do some thoughts of changing the downstairs way up to the reception. Apart from that everything was fantastic and great hotel in best ever location as well as the design, staff and service!!! Had our best time back in Rome, this time with our 2 girls!!! Just returned to our country last night and with the best ever autumn memories ! Trevi bellisimo!

Reviews.Title: “It can be better...”
Reviews.Author: halasz
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the middle of the city. The sights are very close. The room is modern and clean. The breakfast is ok. But...the entrance is very poor. We were there at october. At the breakfast there is NOT view:(

Reviews.Title: “Convivial, central et génial”
Reviews.Author: DotiSherbrooke
Reviews.Content: Depuis l'accueil jusqu'au checking out tout a été parfait. L'accueil de l'hotek est situé au 5 ieme étage (côté original), notre chambre pour 3 (deux adultes et un jeune) était spacieuse, moderne et très propre. La clim nous a permis d'éviter le bruit de la rue. La localisation est excellent. Le petit déjeuner était très satisfaisant (hormis le jus). Seule la salle du pettit-dej était petite et nous avons du mangé sur deux tables séparées à plusieurs reprises. Sinon tout était parfait!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodations and location”
Reviews.Author: mywinderig
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Trevi Collection hotel prior to our cruise out of Civitavecchia. It was a spacious room in a very good location near the metro and the top of the Spanish steps. There were restaurants and lots of stores nearby in addition to easy walking to the Trevi Fountain and Pantheon. It also really wasn't that far from the Colisseum. Danielle, the receptionist, welcomed us as we arrived in the morning around 11:00. She held our bags for us as we went out for lunch; when we returned at 12:30, our room was ready to go. The bathroom was great--dual sinks and a wonderful shower. It was air-conditioned, and there was a little safe to use, also. At breakfast, it was certainly a step above the coffee and danish. There was a tray of meat, cheeses, fruit, and cereal also. the cappucino was also very nice. I think that the price was very reasonable considering we were in Rome in the summer tourist season, and certainly could have paid a higher price somewhere else. Our room was #501, although other rooms were below us on the fourth floor (accessible by a small, European-style elevator). We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Price, Small but Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: davporte
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a family of 4 in a family room. Ideally located and the complimentary breakfasts were just what we needed. For the moaners out there, yes the elevator is small, we just used it twice ... how hard is that. Would highly recommend it, it's not the Ritz, but it's not meant to be and is priced accordingly. Hay it's Rome one of the best tourist walking Cities in the World, your only going to sleep there and it's great for that.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Modern, in the heart of everything, friendly AND REASONABLY PRICED. What more could you ask?”
Reviews.Author: Lisawishpink
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Trevi Collection Guesthouse for 2 nights on the 14th and 15th of June. It was our first time in Europe as a family, and we were a little nervous booking a hotel as everything seemed so expensive in Rome, and price didn't seem to guarantee a good stay! My main priorities were position, and cleanliness. As we were travelling with 2 children and wanted them in the room with us, that narrowed our choices a lot. What a pleasure the Trevi Collection was. We arrived very early on Tuesday morning, well aware that we could not check in until 2pm, but hoping to drop our luggage. The delightful receptionist made us coffee, gave us a map, found some cake for the children and upgraded us to a suite which was made available for us at 10.30am! We went out to explore while we waited and the excitement from the children when we got back and saw our room was delightful to see. The main bedroom area was separated from the 2 full sized single beds for the children by an 'open wall/bedhead. They had a little desk in their area to draw on, which was perfect. Decor was modern and lovely, and there was a HUGE spa bath in the master bedroom area. The bathroom was up a couple of steps, and the glass shower screen overlooked the spa bath. We had 2 big windows with shutters that we could open to let the sights and sounds of Rome in, but which were double glazed for absolute quiet when we wanted to sleep. The blackout curtains were very effective, and this really helped with jet lag (as did getting out into the sun and walking around on our first day rather than falling into bed!) Everything was spotlessly clean. In the morning the church bells nearby ring out a wonderful tune if you want to hear them, and the Spanish Steps are a few steps up the hill, while the Trevi fountain is 5 minutes' walk away. We visited it 4 times in our 2 days as we loved it so much. We found all staff to be helpful and friendly, and the ladies who served breakfast were delightful, as was the breakfast room. We enjoyed the European style breakfast. The apple cake was obviously home-made and was stunning and there were eggs both mornings - once an omelette on the buffet table, and once boiled eggs. We didn't mind taking the stairs to our room on the 4th floor, as the lift was tiny and antique, and we prefer to walk anyway. It was tricky to get suitcases up in one go, but as there were 2 adults, we put the cases in with one adult and everyone else took the stairs! I felt the lift was not an issue at all. The service provided by reception was great, they booked our time slot at the Villa Borghese for us and followed through to let us know, and helped with translating for us when we needed to make a phone call. They also helped with booking a bike tour of Rome with Bici e Baci, which was the best thing we did by far. We saw more in 3 hours than we did walking the streets for a whole day, and the children's legs were fresh for an afternoon at the Roman Forum. The only things we were not thrilled with were a restaurant recommendation to the Wine and Grill (The worst meal we had on our 5 week trip) and the car service to the airport which was in a very old van with no air conditioning, exhaust fumes which made our 6-year-old ill in the back seat and terrible suspension - avoid it and book for yourself the official airport shuttle which we found fantastic on the way to the hotel. These were very minor things overall as we LOVED LOVED LOVED the hotel and had a wonderful stay. Friends of ours stayed at a hotel near the Roman Forum which they also liked, but they paid double what we had paid for their family of 4 to squish into a tiny room. I can't recommend Trevi Colletion Guesthouse highly enough for families, you just have to get over the fact that it's a cross between a hotel and an apartment complex and therefore doesn't have restaurants and bars. With the whole of Rome literally within walking distance, who needs those?

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: Mii_01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Trevi Collection- Guest House just a few feet from the Spanish Steps. This hotel was very Americanized- great spacious rooms (clean), big washroom with double bowl sinks, perfect working shower and air conditioning.... a Hot breakfast in the morning included in the price! The front desk staff spoke English well and were extremely sweet... offered to assist us with booking tours. We felt as if we were walking into our own apartment as the lobby is located on the 4th floor. A european lift (tiny elevator could hold 4 adults who knew each other well) assisted with luggage. We had a spacious corner room which was quiet... only heard our neighbors once the morning they were checking out. The restaurants within walking distance are incredible- nice to be in that location- close to the metro and in the middle of everything- easy to walk around. Cute little jazz bar -literally around the corner (which you did not hear from the hotel). Very pleased- we stayed 3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great in all aspects”
Reviews.Author: amandag722
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location for site-seeing, restaurants, and shopping. It was very clean and modern. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We made reservations and were upgraded to a superior room upon arrival (with no prior request) with two balconies. It was gorgeous. Put simply, this hotel was wonderful and I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel location for our 1st trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: kinsterlau
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 4 nights at the Trevi Collection in May. We were celebrating our 25th Anniversary and wanted everything to be just right. The room was somewhat small but no complaints. Bathroom had nice modern decor and very clean. Hotel lobby was on the 5th floor and our room was on the 4th floor. With their "small" elevator, it made it a bit awkward to bring up our luggages but manageable. The location was just minutes from the Spanish Steps & Trevi Fountain and walking distance to just about everything else. Morning breakfast was nice. The gal serving the breakfast was really super nice. She was the only person we tipped. Oh yea, if you want to use the free internet in the room, you'll need to bring your own ethernet cable. Worked like a charm. Since this was our first trip to Rome, it was a good hotel choice. When we do make our way back again, we will probably stay at a more conventional hotel with a lobby on the main floor and closer to the crowds. Thanks Hotel Trevi Collections for helping to make our anniversary very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room and service”
Reviews.Author: hoskerwm
Reviews.Content: Hi we stayed here in April and Cynthia the receptionist was excellent very helpful and very friendly… the room was excellent smart apartment with jacuzzi in the room… very comfortable beds, quiet and breakfast was very good, self service… they have plans to add more facilities on other floors which will make this a top class hotel… doesnt have comunal bar but a few steps up from the hotel is an excellent jazz bar that does great food. It is also in a fantastic location and accessible to everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service and hotel experience!! Location was the main upside.”
Reviews.Author: ReemQtr
Reviews.Content: My friend and I (two women) stayed at the Trevi Collection for 3 nights around mid April 2011. We were really excited to be in Rome and are avid travellers who were taking time off of work for a holiday. I will truly say that we did not have a good experience at this hotel at all. I’m very surprised with the good reviews of this hotel and actually those reviews encouraged us to decide to book at this hotel. Before I explain why we were dissatisfied, I will just quickly note what the few pros were. 1) Hotel is in a good location 2) Bathroom was a good size and clean 3) There is free Internet in the room but it is not Wi-Fi We got to the hotel in the evening and we had 4 small to medium suitcases between the two of us. The hotel is located on the 4th and 5th floor and the reception is on the 5th floor so no lobby when you enter the building. The building is shared between the hotel and offices. The elevator at this building is old and extremely tiny and we had to make two trips in the elevator to take our bags up. We got to the reception and checked in and the person who we encountered was not very friendly (portly, and loud man named Cheseri, I believe). He seemed to be the reception manager. We checked in and he gave us one key card and told us that our room was on the 4th floor. That meant taking the luggage back down the tiny elevator twice to our room. He didn’t offer to assist at all! He didn’t even offer to give us room on the 5th floor and I know they had rooms available because I saw the room occupancy chart on the screen behind him. We were tired and wanted to get to our room so we took our luggage down to our room and there was a glass door in front of the room corridor where you had to scan your key card to get into the corridor. Then when you got to your room you use the same key card to get in. You can press a button to get out of the corridor but cannot get in without the key card and your room has to have the key card in it to have the lights working. I went back to the reception and asked the same guy who checked us in for another key card in case one of us wanted to go out while the other stayed in the room. The man looked at me as if he didn’t know why I would need another card. He seemed reluctant and then responded to me that he would arrange that tomorrow. I didn’t understand why he couldn’t do it at that time. The room size was very small for what we were paying for and I know pictures are almost always not the same as the real thing with rooms but the room was much smaller than expected. The bed was very uncomfortable! The mini-bar was stocked but the refrigerator didn’t work well and therefore nothing in the mini-bar was cold. There was no kettle, tea or instant coffee in the room. I called and asked for an iron and was told irons in the room are not allowed for fire reasons. I even asked that if I had brought a travel iron would I still not be allowed to use it. I was told I wouldn’t be able to. Something like that should be made clear before booking. Breakfast is mediocre with juices that are not fresh. When we checked out, the same guy who checked us in was there and he was very cold. He didn’t ask us how our stay was; he just proceeded with the checkout process. We didn’t have breakfast that morning, so my friend asked him if we could possibly have some coffee. The person who made the coffee was still there. This man, Cheseri gave my friend a hard time and was like you are too late to order coffee. My friend apologized and told him no need but then he told the person to make us coffee. PLEASE NOTE CHECK OUT IS BETWEEN 10:30-11am. They will not extend except for a charge. We were to leave our bags as our flight was in the evening. I asked the man for a receipt because he only gave me back the credit card receipt and he told me he would leave it on one of our bags later. While we were checking out, a European lady with her two children checked into the hotel and we were surprised to see how nice this hotel guy was with them. We were as respectful as this woman was to him, yet he treated us much worse. He even asked the lady and her children if they would like to drink anything (tea or coffee or water). He also helped the lady’s daughter with her luggage! Being discriminated in any way is a very bad thing and especially when you are paying a good amount of money at a hotel, you expect a certain level of service for the value of money. This, we did not receive at all. He definitely treated us differently than he treated other guests and we do not tolerate that kind of treatment. The hotel should have someone managing reception, who is able to receive people who come from all over the world well. We will NOT be staying at this hotel again and will definitely not recommend it to our colleagues, friends, family or anyone we know.

Reviews.Title: “Great location , hospitality and traveller friendly”
Reviews.Author: Chasman57
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, along with my son and daughter just returned from a week in Rome. We stayed at this hotel (2 rooms) and could not have been more satisfied. The Hotel is VERY convienantly located. Leave the hotel, walk up the quiet street for about 1 minute and you are at the top of the Spanish Steps. A 5 minute walk takes you to the Trvevi Fountain. It's so close we walked there 2 or 3 times each day and evening. A 15 minute walk takes you to Piazza Navone, and 30 minutes (an easy walk on side streets) and you are at the collisieum. The rooms were very spacious and clean, and the bathrooms were huge and modern. (we heard about all the tiny ones in Rome so we were very happy with these). The breakfast (included) was very nice, and the blonde girl who worked there was very happy to bring you coffee every morning. Once she knew what you liked, it was automatic every morning when you sat down. The girls at the front desk were great, (their English was very good) and they all went out of their way to make sure we were satisfied with the room and amenities. We would highly recommend this to anyone travelling to Rome !

Reviews.Title: “Extremely comportable hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Taner_tr06
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in quatro room located 5th floor which has enough space and very big bathroom included SPA. Rooms are very clean and quiet. All staff working in the hotel were excellent. Hotel room was very secure, cleaning staff was very kind and respectfull. There are unlimited free high speed internet available wireless in lobby and with ethernet cable in the room (hotel can provide). Location of hotel is very suitable to reach spanish steps and fontana trevi. You can use both metro stations Barbarini and Spagna ( use elevator in the station). Bath room and toilets was very clean and usable. Breakfast was very nice with many kind of foods including egg and non-pork salami. I can strictly advice to travellers to stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “new hotel in great position”
Reviews.Author: Joshuadp
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the trevi collection for 3 nights and simply loved the location of this place! the breakfast was nice, the rooms were spacious and the bathroom was fantastic. we loved that you could have a 3 minute stroll to the spanish steps. for the price that it was, one would expect to have a computer, business centre or wi-fi to use. they only had a plug in space so you could not use wi-fi on the phone or laptop if you didnt have your own cable. it is best to get out at spagna metro station and catch the lift up (with your bags0 so that you can walk down the hill towards the hotel. great place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: marinaay
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Trevi Collection Hotel in December 2010. It's located on very quiet nice street, just 5 minutes walk from Piazza di Spagna, luxury shopping area (via Condotti, via Frattina), metro station Piazza di Spagna or Barberini (line A). The hotel occupies two floors in the building - 4th and 5th. Our room was rather small, but very clean and modern. Actually, everything was new: furniture, bathroom equipment, tv, etc. The breakfast was nice -- fresh and delicious. The personnnel was very friendly, always tryied to help in case you need any help or assistance. I would definately recommend this hotel!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Trevi Collection
HotelInfo.Address: Via Gregoriana, 56, Rome, Italy
